data.title: Brown University Athletics
data.meta_description: Maya DavisUB, BB, FX - 2024: WCGA Scholastic All-American...Named both a USAG and GEC Scholar-Athlete...First Team USAG All-American on floor and Second Team...
data.text:
2024: WCGA Scholastic All-American...Named both a USAG and GEC Scholar-Athlete...First Team USAG All-American on floor and Second Team honoree on bars…Second Team All-GEC honoree on floor…Averaged 9.713 on floor throughout the season…Scored a 9.875 in a home dual meet vs. Bridgeport (3/10)…Scored 9.850 on vault at the UNH Quad Meet (3/17)…Set a season-high on floor of 9.900 at USAG Team Semifinals, and scored 9.750 on vault to earn All-America honors on both events (4/12).

2023: WCGA Scholastic All-American...Named CSC Academic All-District...USAG Scholar Athlete...GEC Scholar Athlete...Competed in 12 meets during the season…Earned First Team All-America honors by qualifying for the individual event finals at USAG Nationals…Earned Second Team All-GEC honors on floor with her NQS of 9.760… Earned Second Team All-Ivy honors on beam and floor after her performances helped lead Brown to the Ivy Classic title (2/26)…Scored a season-high 9.850 on floor on two occasions in the dual meet vs. Springfield (2/12) and at the USAG Nationals Team Semifinals (4/6)…Scored 9.825 while finishing fifth in the event finals at USAG Nationals…Set a season-high on beam of 9.800 in the dual meet vs. Southern Conn. State (2/5)…Competed on bars in three meets, scoring a season-high 9.750 at the Ivy Classic (2/26).

2022: WCGA Scholastic All-American...GEC Scholar Athlete...Competed in four meets throughout the season, competing on beam and floor…Finished tied for fourth overall after posting a season-high 9.900 on floor at the GEC Championships to earn Second Team All-GEC honors (3/19).

Before Brown: Placed in the top 10 at the New York State Championships and qualified for regionals at Level 10 in 2019 … Won state titles in the all-around, floor, and beam at Level 9 in 2018 … Captured a floor title and placed third in the all-around at regionals at Level 9 in 2018 … Came in third in the all-around and floor at the Eastern National Championships at Level 9 in 2018 … Served team as a captain … Earned team’s Hardest Worker Award and Most Improved Award… Performed for coaches Jack Smith, Gene Alexin, Daniel Xara, and Rebecca Alexin … Competed on the club level for NYC Elite Gymnastics and Gotham Gymnastics, Brooklyn … Missed 2020 season due to COVID and 2021 season due to injury … National Honor Society student and an AP Scholar.

Personal: Maya is the daughter of Donna D’Alessio Davis and John Davis … Has three younger siblings, John, Barrett, and Clayton … Established a leadership program at Gotham Gymnastics to allow for mentorship between gymnasts.

Why Brown? “Brown's open curriculum attracts multi-faceted thinkers, creating a community that encourages inquiry and creativity. Because of this extraordinary community, Brown has been my dream school for years. At Brown, I know I will be able to pursue my passions for science and writing while also exploring other interests such as engineering and architecture. I am so grateful for the opportunity to continue to grow both as a scholar and athlete under this institution.”

Career Highs (thru 2024 season)

Vault: --

Bars: 9.850

Beam: 9.800

Floor: 9.900

All-Around: --
